channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump taps conservative economist to lead statistics agency
item.description: President Trump plans to tap an economist from the conservative Heritage Foundation to oversee the Bureau of Labor Statistics. He fired the previous leader after a disappointing jobs report.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump plans to tap an economist from the conservative Heritage Foundation to oversee the Bureau of Labor Statistics. He fired the previous leader after a disappointing jobs report.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Sheila Jordan, a singular voice in jazz, has died
item.description: She recorded a magical debut album on Blue Note and was later named a Jazz Master by the National Endowment of the Arts.
item.content:encoded: She recorded a magical debut album on Blue Note and was later named a Jazz Master by the National Endowment of the Arts.
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: European Leaders Insist Ukraine Must be Part of Peace Talks
item.description: EU foreign ministers meet ahead of Friday’s Trump-Putin talks in Alaska, with Brussels insisting any peace deal must include Ukraine. And Al Jazeera’s Anas al-Sharif was killed in an Israeli airstrike that also took out the broadcaster's crew in Gaza City.
item.content:encoded: EU foreign ministers meet ahead of Friday’s Trump-Putin talks in Alaska, with Brussels insisting any peace deal must include Ukraine. And Al Jazeera’s Anas al-Sharif was killed in an Israeli airstrike that also took out the broadcaster's crew in Gaza City.
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: Ford says it will roll out a cheaper electric pickup truck
item.description: Ford announced it will retool its Louisville Assembly Plant to focus on electric trucks. Its goal: to bring down prices for U.S. buyers and compete with Chinese EV makers on the global market.
item.content:encoded:
Ford announced it will retool its Louisville Assembly Plant to focus on electric trucks. Its goal: to bring down prices for U.S. buyers and compete with Chinese EV makers on the global market.

(Image credit: Darron Cummings)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Trump says he will 'feel out' Putin in Alaska on ending the war in Ukraine
item.description: President Trump says he thinks Russian President Vladimir Putin is ready to end his war on Ukraine, but he will use a Friday summit to "feel out" his counterpart.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump says he thinks Russian President Vladimir Putin is ready to end his war on Ukraine, but he will use a Friday summit to "feel out" his counterpart.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Trump says Nvidia will hand the U.S. 15% of its H20 chip sales to China
item.description: The president said that Nvidia would pay the government in exchange for easing export restrictions — and that he'd initially asked for a larger cut.
item.content:encoded:
The president said that Nvidia would pay the government in exchange for easing export restrictions — and that he'd initially asked for a larger cut.

(Image credit: Michel Euler)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Judge denies release of Ghislaine Maxwell grand jury transcripts
item.description: President Trump called for the release of the grand jury transcripts after growing pressure to divulge more information about Jeffrey Epstein's case, but the judge on the case said there is nothing new to release.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump called for the release of the grand jury transcripts after growing pressure to divulge more information about Jeffrey Epstein's case, but the judge on the case said there is nothing new to release.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Trump vows to crack down on D.C. crime. And, Putin-Trump meeting to discuss end of war
item.description: President Trump has deployed federal agents in the nation's capital to crack down on crime and homelessness. And, Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin are expected to meet Friday in Alaska.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump has deployed federal agents in the nation's capital to crack down on crime and homelessness. And, Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin are expected to meet Friday in Alaska.

(Image credit: Andrew Leyden)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Conservative writer Max Boot discusses the changing world order
item.description: Steve Inskeep speaks with author and conservative commentator Max Boot about the changing world order.
item.content:encoded: Steve Inskeep speaks with author and conservative commentator Max Boot about the changing world order.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Factories from GE to Kraft Heinz lose immigrant workers, stressing those who remain
item.description: Trump campaigned on helping American workers through his immigration policies. Now that he's revoked work authorization for thousands of immigrants, those left behind are feeling taxed by their absence.
item.content:encoded:
Trump campaigned on helping American workers through his immigration policies. Now that he's revoked work authorization for thousands of immigrants, those left behind are feeling taxed by their absence.

(Image credit: Andrea Hsu)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu
